name: BreastRadAbnormalityMammoMassDensityCS
title: Breast Radiology Abnormality Mammography Mass Density

concept.definition: X-ray attenuation of the mass is greater than the expected attenuation of an equal volume of fibroglandular breast tissue.
(historically, "isodense") X-ray attenuation of the mass is the same as the expected attenuation of an equal volume of fibroglandular breast tissue.

X-ray attenuation of the mass is less than the expected attenuation of an equal volume of fibroglandular breast tissue. A low density mass may be a group of microcysts. If such a finding is identified at mammography, it may very well not be malignant but appropriately may be worked up.
This includes all masses containing fat, such as oil cyst, lipoma or galactocele, as well as mixed density masses such as hamartoma. A fat-containing mass will almost always represent a benign mass.
